parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the radiator can cause engine overheating, leading to engine damage, stalling, or even engine fires, which can result in accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: The temperature gauge is in the red zone
the coolant level is low
the engine is overheating
the vehicle is stalling or shutting down
steam or smoke is coming from the hood.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the thermostat can cause engine overheating or overcooling, leading to engine damage, stalling, or decreased fuel efficiency, which can result in accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: The temperature gauge is in the red zone
the engine is overheating or overcooling
the vehicle is stalling or shutting down
the engine is running rough or misfiring.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Engine fires can cause damage to the vehicle, injuries, or even fatalities, and can occur suddenly and without warning.
symptoms: Flames or smoke are coming from the engine compartment
the vehicle is experiencing a loss of power or stalling
the engine is making unusual noises or smells.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the MAP sensor can cause issues with engine performance, leading to stalling, decreased fuel efficiency, or decreased engine power, which can result in accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: The engine is stalling or running rough
the vehicle is experiencing a loss of power or hesitation
the check engine light is illuminated
the engine is misfiring or having trouble starting.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the rack and pinion steering can cause loss of control of the vehicle, leading to accidents and potential injuries.
symptoms: The steering feels loose or wobbly
the steering wheel/column has excessive play
the vehicle is difficult to steer
the rack and pinion steering needs to be replaced repeatedly.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the tilt steering column can cause loss of control of the vehicle, leading to accidents and potential injuries.
symptoms: The steering column has excessive play
the steering wheel/column has an excessive wobble
the bearings inside the steering column become loose.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The short rear seatbelts can cause injuries or fatalities in the event of an accident, as they may not provide adequate restraint for adult passengers.
symptoms: The rear seatbelts are too short
the buckle on the driver's side comes apart.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The cold power steering issue can cause difficulty steering the vehicle, especially at low speeds, which can lead to accidents or loss of control.
symptoms: The power steering is difficult to use when the engine is cold
the steering feels stiff or heavy.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the engine cradle can cause the control arm to crack, leading to uneven tire wear, loss of vehicle control, and potentially fatal accidents.
symptoms: Cracked engine cradle
uneven tire wear
separation of bolts
frame damage
and engine wear.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Sudden unintended acceleration can cause loss of vehicle control, leading to accidents, injuries, or fatalities.
symptoms: The vehicle suddenly accelerates without warning
often when shifting into gear or when the vehicle is stationary
resulting in unexpected and uncontrolled movement.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Brake System Failure (Rear Brake Locking and Vehicle Spin)
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the brake system can cause the rear wheels to lock, leading to loss of control, spinning, and potential accidents, which can result in injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: Rear brake locking
vehicle spinning
hard braking
brake fluid leakage inside the vehicle
brake pedal feels hard
and requiring excessive force to stop the vehicle.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Brake fluid leakage can cause the brake system to malfunction, leading to reduced braking performance, increased stopping distances, and potential accidents.
symptoms: Brake fluid leakage inside the vehicle
brake pedal feels hard
and requiring excessive force to stop the vehicle.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Power Brake System Failure (Secondary Pump Failure)
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the power brake system can cause the vehicle to lose braking power, leading to increased stopping distances and potential accidents.
symptoms: Brake pedal feels hard
and requiring excessive force to stop the vehicle.
